info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 5:54PM EDT until May 06 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF COLLETON COUNTY... At 554 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bamberg to Lodge to near Early Branch, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Walterboro, Colleton, Smoaks, Lodge, Williams, Islandton, Ruffin, Padgetts, Ashton and Canadys. This warning includes I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 56 and 69. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
